body_html:
Unfortunately the detector requires a newer version of the native libs than the current latest published ones in the TF AAR on bintray. This is due to a native code change in 53aabd5 which added the SSD detector model.

You can work around this most easily by downloading the nightly build of the tensorflow.aar here and placing it into your project. The other option currently is to build the libraries yourself via bazel or make.

When 1.4 is released this issue should be remedied, but we can see about publishing an updated AAR as this is a relatively major issue with the demo.

@jch1 @shawngit fyi

You can work around this most easily by downloading the nightly build of the tensorflow.aar here and placing it into your project. The other option currently is to build the libraries yourself via bazel or make.
When 1.4 is released this issue should be remedied, but we can see about publishing an updated AAR as this is a relatively major issue with the demo.
@jch1 @shawngit fyi
body:
Unfortunately the detector requires a newer version of the native libs than the current latest published ones in the TF AAR on bintray. This is due to a native code change in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/53aabd5cb0ffcc1fd33cbd00eb468dd8d8353df2 which added the SSD detector model.

You can work around this most easily by downloading the nightly build of the tensorflow.aar [here](https://ci.tensorflow.org/view/Nightly/job/nightly-android/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/out/tensorflow.aar) and placing it into your project. The other option currently is to build the libraries yourself via bazel or make.

When 1.4 is released this issue should be remedied, but we can see about publishing an updated AAR as this is a relatively major issue with the demo.

@jch1 @shawngit fyi
